WorkItem.Description:
I've been getting an error when attempting to download from battle.net. The error is new to me up till 2 days ago I could dpwnlaod character information without any problems though it may have been a week or more since I have last done that.
 
I have performed the Suggested Fix and continue to receive this error. If I am posting this message without having performed the Suggested Fix I am aware that I am consuming the Developer(s) time in managing my Issue unnecessarily.
 
== Error Message ==
[Xml_InvalidRootData]
Arguments: ,1,1
Debugging resource strings are unavailable. Often the key and arguments provide sufficient information to diagnose the problem. See http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=106663&Version=4.0.60129.0&File=System.Xml.dll&Key=Xml_InvalidRootData
 
== StackTrace ==
   at System.Xml.XmlTextReaderImpl.Throw(Exception e)
   at System.Xml.XmlTextReaderImpl.Throw(String res, String arg)
   at System.Xml.XmlTextReaderImpl.ParseRootLevelWhitespace()
   at System.Xml.XmlTextReaderImpl.ParseDocumentContent()
   at System.Xml.XmlTextReaderImpl.Read()
   at System.Xml.Linq.XDocument.Load(XmlReader reader, LoadOptions options)
   at System.Xml.Linq.XDocument.Load(TextReader textReader, LoadOptions options)
   at Rawr.Rawr4ArmoryService._webClient_DownloadStringCompleted(Object sender, DownloadStringCompletedEventArgs e)
 
== These are the Steps that I have tried ==
[Please fill in steps here]
 
The only thing I have tried is a page refresh and to re-enter the character information for the battle.net download, since there was no suggested fix.

Comments.Message: Can't test without character info. This is part of the posting guidelines people.
Can you give us the character name and server?
Does this may have something to do with the Armory Maintenance?

I have exactly same issue. I tried with google chrome or IE8...
My silverlight is uptodate, I used windows XP
I tried with my 4 characters in WOW and got same message for 2 days.
My characters are   EU   Cho'gall  elnn    or  EU  cho'gall  elnide

The character name is Nerdling, Realm Anachronos, EU but any character/realm I've tried also generates the same error. I was not aware that providing realm and character info was required as I just followed the instructions provided in the client. Prehaps they should be updated instead of you having a go at people taking the time to report an issue.

I should add the error is still occurring but when I manually go visit battle.net it does say the site is still down so it is likely to be the cause. Perhaps the client could generate a sensible error message when this occurs?
We have all over the site and in the instructions that you need to follow the Posting Guidelines, which tells you to do that.

I'm looking at an armory pull and here's the message they are tossing out on EU's Battle.Net:
===
It’s a busy day for Battle.net!
Due to high volume of traffic, we’ve taken our World of Warcraft and Starcraft II Community sites offline to allow as many users as possible to claim keys, upgrade accounts and manage subscriptions.
As soon as website load is back to normal we’ll open these sites again.
Thank you for your patience!
===

We haven't seen that message before so we weren't handling it. Either way, it's not our fault the website is down just like it would be for maintenance.

Solution: Wait for the website to come back up or use the Addon instead.
